description: 50 seed queries: 5 practice areas x 4 query types x 2-3 queries each

queries.query_text: What is the punishment for murder under BNS?
queries.reference_answer: Section 101 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita prescribes punishment for murder: death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

queries.query_text: What are the ingredients of the offence of cheating under BNS?
queries.reference_answer: Section 318 BNS defines cheating as deceiving a person and thereby dishonestly inducing delivery of property or alteration of valuable security.

queries.query_text: What is the meaning of cognizable offence under BNSS?
queries.reference_answer: Under Section 2(1)(c) of BNSS, a cognizable offence is one in which a police officer may arrest without warrant.

queries.query_text: Can anticipatory bail be granted in cases under Section 85 BNS (cruelty by husband)?
queries.reference_answer: Section 482 BNSS provides for anticipatory bail. The Supreme Court in Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar held that automatic arrest is not warranted under this offence.

queries.query_text: Is dying declaration admissible without corroboration under BSA?
queries.reference_answer: Section 26 BSA (replacing Section 32(1) Indian Evidence Act) provides that a dying declaration is admissible as an exception to hearsay.

queries.query_text: How do common intention and unlawful assembly differ under BNS?
queries.reference_answer: Section 3(5) BNS (replacing Section 34 IPC) deals with common intention, while Section 190 BNS (replacing Section 149 IPC) deals with unlawful assembly.

queries.query_text: What is the relationship between Section 300 IPC (murder) and its exceptions?
queries.reference_answer: Section 300 IPC defines murder with 5 exceptions that reduce it to culpable homicide not amounting to murder under Section 299 IPC.

queries.query_text: What was the bail provision under CrPC Section 437 before BNSS replaced it?
queries.reference_answer: Section 437 CrPC provided for bail in non-bailable offences by a Magistrate. Now replaced by Section 478 BNSS.

queries.query_text: What offences were newly introduced by BNS that had no equivalent in IPC?
queries.reference_answer: BNS introduced Section 111 (organized crime) and Section 113 (mob lynching) as entirely new offences with no IPC equivalent.

queries.query_text: Under what circumstances can police custody be extended beyond 15 days under BNSS?
queries.reference_answer: Section 187 BNSS (replacing Section 167 CrPC) governs remand and detention periods including extensions.

queries.query_text: What are the essentials of a valid contract under the Indian Contract Act, 1872?
queries.reference_answer: Under Sections 10-25 of the Indian Contract Act, a valid contract requires free consent, lawful consideration, competent parties, and lawful object.

queries.query_text: What is the limitation period for filing a suit for recovery of money under a contract?
queries.reference_answer: Under Article 55 of the Limitation Act, 1963, the limitation period for recovery of money due under a contract is 3 years.

queries.query_text: What is the definition of specific performance under the Specific Relief Act?
queries.reference_answer: Section 10 of the Specific Relief Act, 1963 (as amended 2018) provides that specific performance is now enforceable as of right.

queries.query_text: Can an oral agreement for sale of immovable property be specifically enforced?
queries.reference_answer: Section 54 TPA requires a registered instrument for immovable property above Rs. 100. An oral agreement cannot be specifically enforced.

queries.query_text: Is a party entitled to damages for breach of contract even without proving actual loss?
queries.reference_answer: Under Sections 73-74 of the Indian Contract Act, reasonable compensation may be awarded even without proof of exact loss.

queries.query_text: What are the grounds for rejection of plaint under Order VII Rule 11 CPC?
queries.reference_answer: Order VII Rule 11 CPC provides for rejection of plaint where it does not disclose a cause of action, is barred by law, or is insufficiently stamped.

queries.query_text: How do Sections 73 and 74 of the Indian Contract Act interact in claims for liquidated damages?
queries.reference_answer: Section 73 provides for general damages and Section 74 for liquidated damages. Under Section 74, only reasonable compensation is recoverable.

queries.query_text: What is the interplay between Section 9 CPC (jurisdiction) and Order VII Rule 11 CPC (rejection)?
queries.reference_answer: Section 9 CPC grants jurisdiction to courts over all civil matters unless barred. Order VII Rule 11 allows rejection where the suit is barred by any law.

queries.query_text: How did the 2018 amendment to the Specific Relief Act change the remedy of specific performance?
queries.reference_answer: Pre-2018, Section 10 made specific performance discretionary. Post-2018 amendment, it is enforceable as of right subject to limited exceptions in Section 11(2).

queries.query_text: What was the interest rate regime under Section 34 CPC before and after the 2002 amendment?
queries.reference_answer: Pre-2002: court's discretion on interest. Post-2002 Amendment Act 22: rate linked to commercial rates.

queries.query_text: What is the quorum required for a board meeting under the Companies Act, 2013?
queries.reference_answer: Section 174 of the Companies Act, 2013 requires one-third of total strength or two directors, whichever is higher.

queries.query_text: What is the maximum penalty for insider trading under SEBI regulations?
queries.reference_answer: Section 15G SEBI Act prescribes penalty of Rs. 25 crore or 3 times profits, whichever is higher, for insider trading.

queries.query_text: What are the grounds for winding up a company by the Tribunal under the Companies Act, 2013?
queries.reference_answer: Section 271 Companies Act lists grounds for winding up including inability to pay debts and just and equitable grounds.

queries.query_text: Can a secured creditor file Section 7 IBC application and simultaneously enforce SARFAESI Act?
queries.reference_answer: Section 238 IBC gives IBC overriding effect. Innoventive Industries v. ICICI Bank (2018) held IBC prevails over SARFAESI.

queries.query_text: Is oppression and mismanagement under Sections 241-242 Companies Act available against a listed company?
queries.reference_answer: Sections 241-242 Companies Act provide relief for oppression and mismanagement. The Cyrus Mistry v. Tata Sons (2021) case is a key authority.

queries.query_text: How do Sections 7, 9, and 10 of the IBC differ in terms of who can initiate insolvency?
queries.reference_answer: Section 7 (financial creditor), Section 9 (operational creditor), Section 10 (corporate debtor itself) each provide distinct insolvency initiation paths.

queries.query_text: What is the relationship between Section 29A IBC (eligibility) and Section 12A IBC (withdrawal)?
queries.reference_answer: Section 29A bars certain persons from resolution plans. Section 12A allows withdrawal with 90% CoC approval.

queries.query_text: How has the threshold for initiating corporate insolvency changed under IBC since 2016?
queries.reference_answer: Original threshold Rs. 1 lakh (Section 4 IBC). Increased to Rs. 1 crore via March 2020 notification during COVID. Still in effect.

queries.query_text: How did the Companies (Amendment) Act 2017 change auditor-related provisions?
queries.reference_answer: The Companies (Amendment) Act 2017 reorganized auditor provisions. Old Section 227 was replaced by Section 143.

queries.query_text: What was the effect of Section 10A IBC on fresh insolvency filings during COVID?
queries.reference_answer: Section 10A IBC temporarily suspended fresh insolvency filings for COVID defaults (June 2020 to March 2021). It has since expired.

queries.query_text: What is the tax rate on long-term capital gains from equity shares under the Income Tax Act?
queries.reference_answer: Section 112A IT Act (introduced by Finance Act 2018) taxes LTCG on equity shares. Rate changed to 12.5% with Rs. 1.25 lakh exemption post July 2024.

queries.query_text: What deductions are available under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act?
queries.reference_answer: Section 80C allows deduction up to Rs. 1.5 lakh for PPF, ELSS, life insurance, NSC, tuition fees, and home loan principal.

queries.query_text: What is the time limit for issuing reassessment notice under Section 148 IT Act?
queries.reference_answer: Post-2021: Section 148A inquiry mandatory before Section 148 notice. Time limits under Section 149: 3 years general, 10 years if escaped income exceeds Rs. 50 lakh.

queries.query_text: Can the Income Tax Department invoke Section 263 to revise an assessment passed after due application of mind?
queries.reference_answer: Section 263 requires twin conditions: order must be erroneous AND prejudicial to revenue. Malabar Industrial Co. v. CIT established this test.

queries.query_text: Is income from cryptocurrency taxable under Section 115BBH or general IT Act provisions?
queries.reference_answer: Section 115BBH (inserted 2022) imposes flat 30% tax on Virtual Digital Assets with no deduction except cost of acquisition.

queries.query_text: How do Sections 68-69C of the Income Tax Act collectively address unexplained income?
queries.reference_answer: Sections 68, 69, 69A, 69B, 69C cover unexplained cash credits/investments/money/expenditure. All taxed at 60% + surcharge under Section 115BBE.

queries.query_text: What is the interplay between GAAR (Sections 95-102 IT Act) and SAAR provisions like Section 68?
queries.reference_answer: GAAR (Chapter X-A, Sections 95-102, effective 2017) is the general anti-avoidance framework. SAAR provisions like Section 68 are specific. GAAR applies notwithstanding tax treaties.

queries.query_text: How do Sections 148, 148A, and 149 IT Act form the reassessment scheme?
queries.reference_answer: Section 148A mandates preliminary inquiry. Section 148 is the reassessment notice. Section 149 sets time limits (3 years general, 10 years for Rs. 50 lakh+).

queries.query_text: How has the reassessment procedure under Section 147-148 IT Act changed across the 2021 and 2023 amendments?
queries.reference_answer: Pre-2021: reason to believe sufficed. Post-2021: mandatory Section 148A inquiry. Ashish Agarwal v. Union of India (2022) validated the transition.

queries.query_text: How did the GST regime replace the earlier indirect tax structure in India?
queries.reference_answer: The 101st Constitutional Amendment (Article 246A) enabled GST, replacing Central Excise, Service Tax, VAT/Sales Tax, and Entry Tax.

queries.query_text: What are the fundamental rights guaranteed under Part III of the Constitution of India?
queries.reference_answer: Part III (Articles 14-32) guarantees right to equality (14-18), freedoms (19-22), against exploitation (23-24), religion (25-28), cultural rights (29-30), and remedies (32).

queries.query_text: What is the procedure for amendment of the Constitution under Article 368?
queries.reference_answer: Article 368 provides for three categories of amendments: simple majority, special majority, and special majority plus state ratification.

queries.query_text: What is the definition of State under Article 12 of the Constitution?
queries.reference_answer: Article 12 defines State to include the Government and Parliament of India, State Governments and Legislatures, and all local or other authorities.

queries.query_text: Can the right to privacy be invoked against a private entity under Article 21?
queries.reference_answer: K.S. Puttaswamy v. Union of India (2017) established privacy as a fundamental right under Article 21. Horizontal application against private entities remains limited.

queries.query_text: Under what circumstances can President's rule under Article 356 be subject to judicial review?
queries.reference_answer: S.R. Bommai v. Union of India (1994) established that President's rule under Article 356 is subject to judicial review for mala fides or irrelevant considerations.

queries.query_text: What is the basic structure doctrine and how does it limit constitutional amendments?
queries.reference_answer: In Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala (1973), the Supreme Court held that Parliament cannot alter the basic structure of the Constitution under Article 368.

queries.query_text: How do Articles 14, 15, and 16 interact in the context of reservation policy?
queries.reference_answer: Article 14 (equality), Article 15(4) (special provisions for SC/ST/OBC), Article 16(4) (reservation in employment) form the reservation framework.

queries.query_text: How do Articles 32 and 226 differ in terms of writ jurisdiction?
queries.reference_answer: Article 32 (SC writs for fundamental rights only, is itself a fundamental right) vs Article 226 (HC writs, broader scope, not limited to fundamental rights).

queries.query_text: How has Article 370 been affected by the 2019 Presidential Order?
queries.reference_answer: The Constitution (Application to J&K) Order 2019 effectively abrogated Article 370. In Re: Article 370 (2023), the SC Constitution Bench upheld this.

queries.query_text: How did the 103rd Constitutional Amendment introduce economic reservation?
queries.reference_answer: The 103rd Amendment (2019) inserted Articles 15(6) and 16(6) providing 10% reservation for EWS. Upheld by SC in Janhit Abhiyan (2022) by 3:2 majority.
